contentrichtext.text: {{TOCright}} '''[[Om]]''' is a sacred syllable of Hinduism, Buddhism and Jainism. The syllable ''Om'' is also referred to as '''Omkara'''<ref>http://allfaith.com/Religions/Hinduism/omkara.html</ref> '''OM''' and similar may also refer to: ==Music== * [[Om (band)]], a drone metal band * [[Om (John Coltrane album)|''Om'' (John Coltrane album)]], a 1965 album * [[OM (Negură Bunget album)|''OM'' (Negură Bunget album)]], a 2006 album * [[Om (Soulfly album)|''Om'' (Soulfly album)]], a 2002 album also known as ''3'' *[[Om (Ibarra album)|''Om'' (Ibarra album)]], a 1996 album * [[OM Festival]], a Canadian electronic music festival * [[Om Records]], a San Francisco-based dance music record label, home to artist like J Boogie, Kaskade, and King Kooba * [[Om (The Moody Blues song)|"Om" (The Moody Blues song)]], a 1969 song * [[Of Machines]], a post-hardcore band ==Fiction== * [[Om (Kannada film)|''Om'' (Kannada film)]], a 1995 Indian Kannada film * [[OM (film)|''OM'' (film)]], a 2003 film featuring Attin Bhalla as Om * [[Omkara (2004 film)]], a 2004 Indian Kannada film * [[Omkara (2006 film)]], a 2006 Indian Bollywood film * The [[Great God Om]], a fictional deity in the ''Discworld'' universe * [[Sleeping Forest#Om|Om]], a character from the Air Gear manga * The lead character's name from the 2007 movie Om Shanti Om, played by [[Shahrukh Khan]] ==Initialisms== * [[offering memorandum]], in finance, "the OM", prospectus for a bond offering * [[Odyssey of the Mind]], an international problem-solving competition for students * [[Officine Meccaniche]], a former Italian motor vehicle manufacturer * [[Otitis media]], an infection of the middle ear * [[Organic matter]] * [[Operation Mobilisation]], a Christian non-profit missions organization * [[Operation Mindfuck]], a very important practice within Discordianism * [[Order of Merit]], the post-nominal letters indicating membership in a high honour from the monarch of the Commonwealth realms * [[Order of the Minims]], the post-nominal letters indicating membership in a Roman Catholic religious order founded by Francis of Paola in the fifteenth century in Italy * [[Olympique de Marseille]], a French football club * [[Orlando Magic]], a basketball team in the NBA * [[Operating margin]] * [[Order of Manitoba]], the post-nominal letters indicating membership in an honour of the Crown in Right of Manitoba * Old Man (meaning a male [[Amateur radio operator#Gender|amateur radio operator]]) * [[Openmoko Linux]], a mobile operating system developed by the Openmoko project * [[Osipkov-Merritt model]] * [[Osteomyelitis]], a bone marrow infection * [[Oto-Manguean languages]] * [[Old Millfieldians]], alumni of Millfield School * [[List of Old Marlburians|Old Marlburians]], alumni of Marlborough College ==Others== * [[Om River]], a river in Siberia, Russia * [[Aum Shinrikyo]], a Japanese new religious movement, known for carrying out the Sarin gas attacks in the Tokyo subways * [[Ohm (unit)]], a unit of electrical resistance * Omu Peak (2507 m) in the [[Bucegi Mountains]] * [[Olympus OM system]], a family of Olympus SLR cameras made between 1972 and 2002 * [[Georg Ohm]], a German physicist * [[Oman]], ISO 3166 country code ** [[.om]], the country code top level domain (ccTLD) for Oman * [[MIAT-Mongolian Airlines]] IATA code * OM AB, the name of a Swedish exchange which merged with Finnish HEX plc to become [[OMX]] == References == {{reflist}} ==See also== * [[OMS (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
